intro: Cremanthodium cremanthodioides, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. The species is part of the tribe Cardueae within the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and specific morphological features.
